xxl.core.functions
Class Switch<I,R>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.functions.AbstractFunction<java.lang.Object,R>
      xxl.core.functions.Switch<I,R>
Type Parameters:
I - the type of the identifiers used for identifying the different cases.
R - the result type of the switch function, i.e., a supertype for all given functions modeling the cases of the switch function.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, Function<java.lang.Object,R>
public class Switch<I,R>
extends AbstractFunction<java.lang.Object,R>

This class provides a functional switch statement. Arbitrary functions can be registered to the switch function using an unique identifier for each function. When the switch function is invoked, the first parameter of the invocation method is taken as the identifier of the internally stored function to be executed. If there is not such a case a function representing the default case is invoked.
Note, that the iterations returned by the methods identifiers and functions deliver their data in the same order as it is put in the switch function. When a map is specified to the constructor that already contains some functions the order of them is specified by the map's keySet method.

See Also:

Field Detail

functions

protected java.util.Map<I,Function<java.lang.Object,? extends R>> functions
A map that is used to store the functions representing the different cases of this switch function.

identifiers

protected java.util.ArrayList<I> identifiers
An array-list storing the identifiers of the functions representing the different cases of the switch function. This list is internally used to save the order the functions representing the different cases of this switch function are put in it.

defaultFunction

protected Function<java.lang.Object,? extends R> defaultFunction
The default case of this switch function. It is invoked when is does not contain a function for a given identifier.

Constructor Detail

Switch

public Switch(java.util.Map<I,Function<java.lang.Object,? extends R>> functions,
              Function<java.lang.Object,? extends R> defaultFunction)
Creates a new switch function using the functions and their identifiers stored in the given map to represent its different cases and the specified function for representing the default case. The order of the stored functions is given by the map's keySet method.

Parameters:
functions - a map storing the functions and their identifiers used to represent its different cases.
defaultFunction - a function representing the default case of this switch function.

Switch

public Switch()
Creates a new switch function without a specified case and a function representing the default case that returns an IllegalArgumentException if it is invoked. In order to replace the default case by a meaningful one, call the putDefault with the desired function.

Method Detail

put

public Function<java.lang.Object,? extends R> put(I identifier,
                                                  Function<java.lang.Object,? extends R> function)
Associates the specified function with the case specified by the given identifier in this switch function. If the switch function previously contained a function dealing with this case, the old function is replaced by the specified function.

Parameters:
identifier - an unique identifier associated with the case the specified function deals with.
function - the function that deals with the case associated with the given identifier.
Returns:
the function that previously dealt with the case the specified identifier is associated with.

putDefault

public Function<java.lang.Object,? extends R> putDefault(Function<java.lang.Object,? extends R> function)
Associates the specified function with the default case of the switch function and returns the function previously associated with this case.

Parameters:
function - the function that deals with the default case.
Returns:
the function that previously dealt with the default case.

remove

public Function<java.lang.Object,? extends R> remove(I identifier)
Removes the function associated with the specified identifier from this switch function. If the switch function contains a function dealing with this case, the function is removed and returned, otherwise null is returned.

Parameters:
identifier - an unique identifier associated with the function to be removed.
Returns:
the function associated with the specified identifier or null if this switch function contains no function dealing with this case.

get

public Function<java.lang.Object,? extends R> get(I identifier)
Returns the function that deals with the case identified by the given identifier. If the switch function associates no case with this identifier the function representing the default case is returned.

Parameters:
identifier - an unique identifier associated with the case whose function should be returned.
Returns:
the function dealing with the case identified by the given identifier or the function representing the default case if there is no such case.

getDefault

public Function<java.lang.Object,? extends R> getDefault()
Returns the function representing the default case of this switch function.

Returns:
the function representing the default case of this switch function.

contains

public boolean contains(I identifier)
Returns true if and only if this switch function contains a function that deals with the case identified by the given identifier. If it associates no case with this identifier false is returned.

Parameters:
identifier - an unique identifier associated with the case that should be tested for being handled by this switch function.
Returns:
true if and only if this switch function contains a function that deals with the case identified by the given identifier, otherwise false.

identifiers

public Cursor<I> identifiers()
Returns an iteration over the identifiers associated with the cases of this switch function. This iteration delivers its data in the same order as it is put in the switch function. When a map is specified to the constructor that already contains some functions the order of them is specified by the map's keySet method.

Returns:
an iteration containing the identifiers associated with the cases of this switch function.

functions

public Cursor<Function<java.lang.Object,? extends R>> functions()
Returns an iteration over the functions dealing with the cases of this switch function. This iteration delivers its data in the same order as it is put in the switch function. When a map is specified to the constructor that already contains some functions the order of them is specified by the map's keySet method.

Returns:
an iteration containing the functions dealing with the cases of this switch function.

invoke

public R invoke(java.util.List<? extends java.lang.Object> arguments)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the result of the switch function as an object. The first element of the given Object array is used to identify the case of the switch function that should be invoked. Thereafter all arguments are used to invoke the function that represents the desired case. Because at least one argument is needed by the switch function to identify the case to be invoked, this method throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is invoked with zero arguments or an empty Object array.

Specified by:
invoke in interface Function<java.lang.Object,R>
Overrides:
invoke in class AbstractFunction<java.lang.Object,R>
Parameters:
arguments - the arguments to the switch function whereas the first element of the Object array identifies the case of the switch function to be invoked with the remaining elements.
Returns:
the return value of the function representing the case identified by the first element of the given Object array.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the invoke method is called without any arguments or with an empty Object array or the switch function associates no case with the given identifier and the function representing the default case is not set.
